abstract.text: Discover how you can achieve maximum performance and insightful debugging with your app. Symbolication is at the center of tools such as Instruments and LLDB to help bridge the layers between your applicationâ€™s runtime and your source code. Learn how this process works and the steps you can take to gain the most insight into your app.

Goal: translate a runtime memory address to a corresponding address in your binary on disk (a.k.a. file addresses)
Your app has an address space on disk.
assigned by the linker
the linker groups the file into segments
each segment has certain properties, such as a name, a size, and their assigned addresses
segment of your binary contains all of the functions and methods youâ€™ve written
segment contains program-wide state such as global variables
each of these segments gets assigned a different address such that they donâ€™t overlap
the linker records this information at the very beginning of your executables as part of the Mach-O header
Mach-O is the format used for all executable binaries and libraries, and the system knows that it needs to read this header to run your apps.
the Mach-O header contains a number of load commands that hold the segment properties
the system uses these load commands to load the segments into memory
if your apps are Universal 2, then the app will have one header and a set of segments for each architecture
We can inspect these load commands by using
in the terminal, which prints the load commands for a specified file
Before the kernel actually loads the segments, it initializes a random value known as the ASLR slide
this is to randomize the addresses values, itâ€™s a safety feature
all runtime addresses will be shifted by this ASLR slide
the difference between a runtime address and the linker address is the ASLR slide
we can always go back to the file address space once we know the ASLR slide

abstract.text: Learn how you can link your app to Quick Note and help people quickly connect your content to their notes â€” and their notes to your content. Discover how Quick Note recognizes and links to app content through NSUserActivity, and find out how you can adopt this API in your app. Weâ€™ll take you through the requirements, benefits, and features of supporting Quick Note. Weâ€™ll also provide guidance and best practices for NSUserActivity to help your app get all of its benefits.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Adopt Quick Note
Detect people, faces, and poses using Vision

abstract.text: Discover the latest updates to the Vision framework to help your apps detect people, faces, and poses. Meet the Person Segmentation API, which helps your app separate people in images from their surroundings, and explore the latest contiguous metrics for tracking pitch, yaw, and the roll of the human head. And learn how these capabilities can be combined with other APIs like Core Image to deliver anything from simple virtual backgrounds to rich offline compositing in an image-editing app.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Bring Core Data concurrency to Swift and SwiftUI

abstract.text: Discover how Core Data is adopting the new concurrency capabilities of Swift 5.5, leading to more concise, efficient, and safe asynchronous code. Weâ€™ll show you how to update Core Data in your apps to work with concurrency, and detail the many other improvements throughout the framework that make working with Swift and SwiftUI more expressive and powerful.

With Create ML, your appâ€™s ability to understand the expressiveness of the human hand has never been easier. Discover how you can build off the support for Hand Pose Detection in Vision and train custom Hand Pose and Hand Action classifiers using the Create ML app and framework. Learn how simple it is to collect data, train a model, and integrate it with Vision, Camera, and ARKit to create a fun, entertaining app experience.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Classify hand poses and actions with Create ML
Discover account-driven User Enrollment

abstract.text: Learn how User Enrollment helps you support â€œbring your own deviceâ€ deployments in your business or enterprise environment. Weâ€™ll explore data separation, enhancements to Managed Apple IDs and how you can use the new account-based onboarding in your organization.

Discover Swift concurrency in action: Follow along as we update an existing sample app. Get real-world experience with async/await, actors, and continuations. Weâ€™ll also explore techniques for migrating existing code to Swift concurrency over time.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Swift concurrency: Update a sample app

abstract.text: Discover how you can use HLS playlist tags and the Steering Manifest format with your content to help dynamically update CDN redundancy policies tuned for each viewer. Learn how to load balance, set failover, and more.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Improve global streaming availability with HLS Content Steering
Manage software updates in your organization

abstract.text: In a managed device environment, you often need to control the pace of software updates while you test the latest operating systems within your company or education institution. Discover the tools you have at your disposal to defer, deploy, and enforce software updates.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Discover breakpoint improvements

abstract.text: Breakpoints can help you debug issues by allowing you to pause and inspect problems in the middle of a process. Discover the latest improvements to breakpoints in Xcode including column and unresolved breakpoints. Weâ€™ll also go over best practices for general breakpoints and LLDB tips and tricks.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Send communication and Time Sensitive notifications

abstract.text: Learn more about the evolution of notifications on Apple platforms. Weâ€™ll explore how you can help people manage notifications within your app, including how you can craft meaningful moments with interruption levels and Time Sensitive notifications. And weâ€™ll introduce you to communication notifications, providing a richer experience for calls and messages in your app through SiriKit.

Unleash the full potential of your shaders and implement modern rendering techniques by adding Argument Buffers to adopt bindless rendering. Learn how to make your entire scene and resources available to the GPU to make the most out of raytracing and rasterization pipelines.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Explore bindless rendering in Metal

abstract.text: Learn how Xcode Organizer makes it easier and faster to triage and fix crashes. Weâ€™ll explore how you can get access to crash information and feedback from your TestFlight testers just moments after they occur. And weâ€™ll show you how to analyze crashes, view metrics, and even share crash information among your team.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Triage TestFlight crashes in Xcode Organizer
Discoverable design

abstract.text: Discover how you can create interactive, memorable experiences to onboard people into your app. Weâ€™ll take you through discoverable design practices and learn how you can craft explorable, fun interfaces that help people grasp the possibilities of your app at a glance. Weâ€™ll also show you how to apply this methodology to personalize your content and make your app easy to customize.

An inclusive app or game is not only usable by different people, but also welcomes people from diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Discover how you can design inclusive content for your interface, language, imagery, and marketing materials and support the broadest possible range of people with your app or game.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: The practice of inclusive design
Deliver a great playback experience on tvOS

abstract.text: Find out how you can use Apple TVâ€™s redesigned playback interface to build great media experiences in your apps. Learn how the latest interface helps people access relevant controls and information while maintaining focus on content. Weâ€™ll show you how you can adopt AVPlayerViewController and other APIs for your tvOS app to help people find, play, and enjoy content.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Tailor the VoiceOver experience in your data-rich apps

abstract.text: Learn how to present complex data through VoiceOver with the Accessibility Custom Content API. Discover how you can deliver accessibility information in a concise form, and only when someone wants it. Weâ€™ll show you how you can integrate AXCustomContent and help people who want VoiceOver enabled to navigate your data-rich apps in an efficient manner.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Create 3D workflows with USD

abstract.text: Discover the flexibility, versatility and power of Pixarâ€™s Universal Scene Description (USD) for your 3D workflows. Learn how you can use the USD file format in your professional workflows for macOS: Scan 3D models of your real-world objects using Object Capture, utilize the potential of third-party digital content creation tools, and build high-quality rendered sequences.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Build interactive tutorials using DocC

abstract.text: Discover how you can author immersive tutorials from scratch with DocC. Weâ€™ll demonstrate how you can bring together rich instructions, example code, and images through the DocC syntax to showcase your Swift framework in action. And weâ€™ll go over how to create progressive training that can provide interactive learning opportunities and help people better understand use cases for your framework.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Enhance your app with Metal ray tracing

abstract.text: Achieve photorealistic 3D scenes in your apps and games through ray tracing, a core part of the Metal graphics framework and Shading Language. Weâ€™ll explore the latest improvements in implementing ray tracing and take you through upgrades to the production rendering process. Discover Metal APIs to help you create more detailed scenes, integrate natively-supported content with motion, and more.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Add rich graphics to your SwiftUI app

abstract.text: Learn how you can bring your graphics to life with SwiftUI. Weâ€™ll begin by working with safe areas, including the keyboard safe area, and learn how to design beautiful, edge-to-edge graphics that wonâ€™t underlap the on-screen keyboard. Weâ€™ll also explore the materials and vibrancy you can use in SwiftUI to create easily customizable backgrounds and controls, and go over graphics APIs like drawingGroup and the all new canvas. With these tools, itâ€™s simpler than ever to design fully interactive and interruptible animations and graphics in SwiftUI.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Optimize high-end games for Apple GPUs

abstract.text: Optimize your high-end games for Apple GPUs: Weâ€™ll show you how you can use our rendering and debugging tools to eliminate performance issues and make your games great on Apple platforms. Learn from our experiences working with developers at Larian Studios and 4A Games as we help them optimize their games for Apple GPUs.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Create accessible experiences for watchOS

abstract.text: Discover how you can build a top-notch accessibility experience for watchOS when you support features like larger text sizes, VoiceOver, and AssistiveTouch. Weâ€™ll take you through adding visual and motor accessibility support to a SwiftUI app built for watchOS, including best practices around API integration, experience, and more.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Discover geometry-aware audio with the Physical Audio Spatialization Engine (PHASE)

abstract.text: Explore how geometry-aware audio can help you build complex, interactive, and immersive audio scenes for your apps and games. Meet PHASE, Appleâ€™s spatial audio API, and learn how the Physical Audio Spatialization Engine (PHASE) keeps the sound aligned with your experience at all times â€” helping you create spatial soundscapes and scenes during the development process, rather than waiting until post production. Weâ€™ll take you through an overview of the API and its classes, including Sources, Listeners, Acoustic Geometry, and Materials, and introduce the concept of Spatial Modeling. Weâ€™ll also show you how to quickly combine PHASEâ€™s basic building blocks to start building an integrated audio experience for your app or game.

Weâ€™ll explore the latest updates to Text Recognition and Barcode Detection, show you how to bring all these tools together with Core ML, and help your app make greater sense of the world through images or the live camera.

abstract.text: How do you approach creating apps for everyone? Learn from developers who are blind or deaf themselves as they discuss the process of making technology accessible. Discover how their unique perspectives have sparked innovation at their companies and helped make their apps even more inclusive.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Developer spotlight: Accessibility

abstract.text: At Apple, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right. Learn about our four pillars of privacy, how we brought these principles together to design iCloud Private Relay, and how you can approach building privacy in your app in line with those fundamentals. Explore how you can build data minimization, on-device processing, transparency and control, and security protections right into your app.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Appleâ€™s privacy pillars in focus
Explore HLS variants in AVFoundation

abstract.text: Discover how you can use AVFoundation APIs to highlight different variants of your content within your app. Weâ€™ll show you how you can inspect HLS content using these APIs for different video characteristics, including attributes like SDR/HDR, FPS, and the like. And weâ€™ll explore the AVAssetVariant, which represents streaming and offline content.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Measure health with motion

abstract.text: Discover how you can take your appâ€™s health monitoring to the next level with motion data. Meet Walking Steadiness for iPhone and the six-minute-walk metric for Apple Watch: Walking Steadiness can help your app interpret someoneâ€™s quality of walking and risk of falling, while the six-minute-walk metric â€” along with the HealthKit estimate recalibration API â€” can track changes to walking endurance following acute events like surgery. Weâ€™ll show you how you can support these metrics and help provide actionable health data to people who use your app, helping improve patient care and clinical trials, especially as more services must be delivered remotely.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Build a research and care app, part 1: Setup onboarding

abstract.text: Learn how ResearchKit and CareKit can work together to take the tedium out of paper surveys. Code along with us and build a working care pilot app. Explore best practices for onboarding and consent with ResearchKit, and find out how your app can require participants to sign consent documents by leveraging CareKitâ€™s store and UI components.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Design for spatial interaction

abstract.text: Discover the principles for creating intuitive physical interactions between two or more devices, as demonstrated by Apple designers who worked on features for iPhone, HomePod mini, and AirTag. Explore how you can apply these patterns to your own app when designing features for Apple platforms, and help people using your app interact more directly with their surroundings.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Build a research and care app, part 2: Schedule tasks

abstract.text: Learn how ResearchKit and CareKit can work together to take the tedium out of paper surveys. Continue coding along with us and explore how you can make it easier than ever to schedule surveys for your study participants. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Craft search experiences in SwiftUI

Learn how to use SwiftUIâ€™s .searchable modifier in conjunction with other views to best incorporate search for your app. And weâ€™ll show you how to elevate your implementation by providing search suggestions to help people understand the types of searches they can perform.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Use Accelerate to improve performance and incorporate encrypted archives

abstract.text: The Accelerate framework helps you make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations that are optimized for high-performance, low-energy consumption. doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Explore Nearby Interaction with third-party accessories
SwiftUI on the Mac: The finishing touches

abstract.text: Join us for part two of our Code-Along series as we use SwiftUI to build a Mac app from start to finish. Learn how SwiftUI apps can automatically react to system settings, and discover how you can use that information to add more personality to an app. Weâ€™ll show you how you can give people the flexibility to customize an app through Settings, and explore how to use different workflows for manipulating someoneâ€™s data (like drag and drop). doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Get ready for iCloud Private Relay

abstract.text: iCloud Private Relay is an iCloud+ service that prevents networks and servers from monitoring a personâ€™s activity across the internet. Discover how your app can participate in this transition to a more secure and private internet: Weâ€™ll show you how to prepare your apps, servers, and networks to work with iCloud Private Relay.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Support customers and handle refunds

abstract.text: Great customer support is critical to running a successful business on the App Store. Discover how you can provide a frictionless support experience to customers who make in-app purchases, including APIs that make it easy for customers to manage or cancel their auto-renewable subscription, or request refunds from directly within your app. Weâ€™ll cover best practices for handling refunds, as well as additional APIs that can help you better support your customers.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Use async/await with URLSession

abstract.text: Discover how you can adopt Swift concurrency in URLSession using async/await and AsyncSequence, and how you can apply Swift concurrency concepts to improve your networking code.
